title: Lawmakers Approve More New York City School Speed Cameras
summary: Gov. Andrew Cuomo said he would sign the bill. New York lawmakers on Tuesday approved a bill that will nearly quintuple the number of automated cameras that enforce speed limits around New York City schools.

title: Postpartum Depression Drug Gets FDA Approval
summary: Zulresso, or brexanolone, will be available only through a restricted program at a certified facility. U.S. health regulators on Tuesday approved Sage Therapeutics Inc.'s Zulresso, the first medication specifically intended for women with postpartum depression.

title: House Seeks Answers From Tech CEOs Over Shooting Video
summary: Footage of killings in New Zealand mosques was posted on Facebook, YouTube and Twitter. WASHINGTON-The head of the House Homeland Security Committee asked four technology companies to attend a closed-door briefing next week on their efforts to prevent violent videos from being disseminated in the wake of last week's mass shooting in New Zealand.

title: White House to Nominate Steve Dickson as Permanent FAA Head
summary: Former senior Delta executive would succeed acting administrator Daniel Elwell; Transportation Department wants audit of efforts to certify 737 MAX. With the Federal Aviation Administration facing mounting scrutiny domestically and overseas, the White House said it plans to nominate Steve Dickson, a former senior Delta Air Lines official, as permanent head of the agency.

title: AB InBev Names New Chairman; 3G CEO to Exit Board
summary: Barrington, who was previously chairman and CEO of Marlboro maker Altria, will succeed outgoing Chairman Olivier Goudet. Anheuser-Busch InBev SA named a new chairman and said the CEO of private-equity firm 3G Capital was leaving its board, part of a broader shake-up at the world's biggest brewer as it struggles with slumping sales.

title: Raymond James CFO Retiring After 32-Year Run
summary: Jeff Julien has helped steer his company through market turbulence as finance chief since 1987. America's longest-serving finance chief is stepping down. Jeff Julien, CFO at brokerage Raymond James Financial Inc., is ending his tenure after more than three decades in the role.

title: Can We Listen to Michael Jackson and R. Kelly the Same Way Again?
summary: Students discuss whether it's possible or advisable to separate the art from the artist.. Editor's note: This Future View is about art we love from unethical artists. Next week's question will concern reparations for slavery. Sen. Elizabeth Warren says it's "time to start the national, full-blown conversation" but other Democratic presidential candidates prefer to dodge the question. Let's ask it anyway: "Should America pay reparations for slavery to its African-American citizens?" Students should click here to submit opinions of fewer than 250 words before March 26. The best responses will be published that night.

title: To Understand China, Look to America's History
summary: In challenging Britain's hegemony a century ago, U.S. tactics look similar to Beijing's today.. There's been a good deal of hand-wringing in the U.S. over efforts by the Chinese telecommunications giant Huawei to replace U.S. suppliers of advanced equipment and wire the world with its 5G network. Most analysis of China's strategy turns on the conviction that the Chinese are trying to challenge U.S. commercial and geopolitical hegemony-they steal U.S. technology and then sell their plagiarized equipment at a lower price. Worse, they seek to build an alternative, China-led global telecom infrastructure, positioning Beijing to spy on the users and capture yet more U.S. commerce.

title: The Illogic of Slavery Reparations at This Late Date
summary: How can centuries-old oppression be to blame for problems that became severe only recently?. Sen. Elizabeth Warren told a town-hall audience in Jackson, Miss., Monday that "it's time to start the national, full-blown conversation" about slavery reparations for blacks. Come again? Compensating black Americans for past oppression has been a subject of discussion for decades. The senator's problem is that large majorities of the public have consistently opposed reparations, not that we don't talk about it.

title: The College Admissions Game Brings Out the Snob in Everyone
summary: If your child goes to Yarvton, you're not only a successful parent but a superior human being.. The recent scandal about the rich-and in a few instances the famous-getting their children into colleges through payoffs made to an oily middleman has aroused the nation's ire. Little wonder. The story has lots going for it: corruption, celebrities behaving badly, the wealthy availing themselves of what is thought to be a precious commodity by unfair means. It is the stuff from which (communist) manifestoes are made.

title: Bitcoin Is in the Dumps, Spreading Gloom Over Crypto World
summary: The value of all cryptocurrencies outstanding is down 85% from peak and volumes on U.S. exchanges have been falling; making it through 'winter'. Bitcoin is in the longest slump of its 10-year history. That is forcing even its most ardent supporters to shelve dreams of global disruption and focus on simply tightening their belts long enough to outlast the downturn.

title: Is the Pilot or Robot the Problem?
summary: Aviation faces a turning point on automated flight after a Boeing tragedy.. As more information comes out about two Boeing crashes, it's clear that a big system malfunction was at work. Not the famed "MCAS" system, designed to help a pilot avoid an aerodynamic stall, whose snafu is strongly implicated in last October's crash of a late-model 737 MAX in Indonesia and is suspected in last week's crash of a 737 MAX in Ethiopia.

title: College Scammers Hurt the Disabled
summary: Accommodations are no 'privilege.' They level the playing field.. In the college cheating scandal exposed last week, some parents allegedly had their children "purport to have learning disabilities" to get extra time on standardized tests. Part of the damage these parents have done is to contribute to the perception that disability accommodations confer unfair advantages.

title: Strike Four, You're Out!
summary: No harm painting the foul poles blue, but don't mess with the rules of the game.. From my seat behind third base I noticed something strange about the foul poles down the right- and left-field lines. They were baby blue.

title: 'Armies of Deliverance' Review: The Fight for Salvation
summary: Few now question the Civil War's underlying cause: slavery. But what motivated soldiers to ﬁght so bloody a conflict for so long?. One month after the first shots of the Civil War were fired at Fort Sumter, the New York Herald thundered that white Southerners were "ripe for their deliverance from the most revolting despotism on the face of the earth." Four years later, the rival New York Times marked the South's subjugation with "gratitude for deliverance" and a reminder of "the moral elements of the national cause." That a pro-Lincoln, pro-Republican, pro-emancipation newspaper like the Times would invoke the theme of deliverance at the end of the war comes as little surprise. But that an anti-Lincoln, white supremacist-albeit pro-Union-daily like the Herald could have evangelized the morality of the Northern cause at the very outset comes across as breathtaking.

title: Publishers Sue Peloton for Use of Songs From Drake, Lady Gaga
summary: Downtown Music, Pulse Music, Ole and others say the company has failed to license with them for use of their songwriters' compositions, resulting in lost income. A group of music publishers representing the songwriters of hits from Justin Timberlake, Gwen Stefani, Drake, Lady Gaga and others is suing Peloton Interactive Inc. for copyright infringement, alleging the maker of video-streaming stationary exercise bikes used over 1,000 musical works without permission.

title: Another Ninth Circuit Reversal
summary: The Supreme Court sides with Congress on criminal alien detention.. The Supreme Court reversed the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals again Tuesday in an immigration case that turned on a clear-cut question of statutory interpretation. While the 5-4 conservative majority read the law as it was written, the Court's liberals would have overruled Congress.

title: Europe's China Dilemma
summary: The Continent shows a new realism as Xi seeks to divide and dominate.. Even those who don't agree with President Trump's trade policy concede that he has a point about China's often predatory practices. Last week he received intellectual reinforcement of all places from the European Union, which issued a report calling China an "economic competitor" and systemic political rival-sharp language for a region that once considered China a partner to replace an inward-looking U.S.

title: Targeting the Electoral College
summary: Democrats tee up another constitutional norm for a rewrite.. Last week we wrote about Democratic ambitions to pack the Supreme Court. This week the Electoral College is on the chopping block as Senator Elizabeth Warren comes out in favor of its abolition, Beto O'Rourke makes sympathetic noises and Colorado's Democratic Governor signs a bill adding his state to the "National Popular Vote Interstate Compact." Scrapping the system the U.S. has used to select Presidents since its founding will likely soon be the Democrats' default position.

title: Google Offers Concessions on Eve of New EU Antitrust Rebuke
summary: Tech giant will offer all Android users in Europe a choice of rival search engines and web browsers, after EU asked it to improve compliance with prior antitrust decisions.. Google plans to ask all Android smartphone users in Europe whether they want to switch to competing search engines or web browsers, one of two new concessions the search giant is offering to stave off complaints-and potential fines-from European Union antitrust regulators.

title: FedEx Lowers Outlook as Express Unit Struggles
summary: Delivery giant posts drop in sales at express unit, which has changed CEOs twice in three months. FedEx Corp. cut its outlook for the second consecutive quarter after it reported a decline in revenue in its express unit and lower profit in its ground business from the higher cost of operating six days a week.

title: Mosque Shooter's Radical Views Fed by Trips to Christian-Muslim Battlegrounds
summary: Resume Subscription. In the months leading up to last week's New Zealand mosque massacre, the suspected gunman traveled through some of history's most obscure battlegrounds between Christians and Muslims.

title: Supreme Court Approves Mandatory Detention of Some Immigrants During Deportation Hearings
summary: Decision requires authorities to detain aliens facing deportation at any point following release from prison for range of offenses. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court said Tuesday that certain immigrants who have served jail sentences must be held without bail during deportation proceedings, the second 5-4 decision in a year to adopt the government's expansive definition of aliens subject to mandatory detention.

title: Investors Have a FedEx Problem
summary: Weak results from the shipping giant bode poorly for the global economy, and investors don't seem ready for a slowdown. Global investors, who have enjoyed an excellent start to 2019, received some unsettling news from FedEx Corp.

title: Cities Lack Family Apartments. Developer of Adult Dorms Has an Answer.
summary: Collaboration of Common and Tishman Speyer launches smaller family apartments with shared playrooms, on-demand child care via mobile app. A co-living company whose dormlike accommodations have become popular with single 20-somethings has a new customer in mind: families.

title: If This Is Failure, Show Me Success
summary: Starboard Value's example of a bad pharmaceuticals acquisition is highly debatable.. In a nearly 200-page presentation calling for investors to reject Bristol-Myers Squibb 's proposed acquisition of Celgene released on Monday, activist hedge fund Starboard Value called Celgene's pipeline of new drugs "unproven." The hedge fund said relying on that pipeline "adds incredible risk" for Bristol-Myers and could force additional acquisitions in the future. One example Starboard cited is Merck & Co.'s $41.1 billion deal for Schering-Plough back in 2009.

title: 'Less Marx, More Mises' Shows Development
summary: Students For Liberty provides professional development training for students.. In "The College 'Grass-Roots' Organizations That Aren't" (op-ed, March 9), Daniel M. Bring states that our organization, Students For Liberty (SFL), doesn't provide professional development to students.

title: College Scandal Deserves an F for Integrity
summary: American universities have surrendered a piece of their educational mission to an array of alternative missions.. Regarding your editorial "The College Admissions Racket" (March 14): University admissions offices are far from exclusively devoted to judging academic merit. They have quotas for various applicant categories-or more likely upper and lower bounds for each category. These consist, typically, of children of alumni and donors, minority applicants in various subcategories, athletes, students from "underrepresented" states or from deprived backgrounds and so on. Beyond those categories, admissions offices have vast discretion about whom to admit.

title: It's Time to Let a Hundred Internet Flowers Bloom
summary: Solutions to issues of free speech and reporting lie in the future, on the next frontier, in the next "beta"-not in a government-mandated return to the past.. Robert Thomson calls for government to tame the "Wild West" of America's tech industry, to bring it out of "beta" ("Taming the Digital Wild West," March 13). He seeks a "cyber Solomon," a philosopher king, to ensure tech reaches its true potential-presumably by threatening to split the tech baby. He claims tech today "gives no true sense of perspective."

title: Ohio Joins States Hitting Drivers Where It Hurts: Raising Gas Taxes
summary: Transportation officials say a $1 billion infrastructure spending was masked for more than a decade by borrowing. Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine is pushing for an 18-cent-per-gallon increase in the state's gas tax after he said he discovered a $1 billion infrastructure spending hole that transportation officials say was masked for more than a decade by borrowing.

title: Trump Backs Stronger Ties With Brazil
summary: President supports naming the country a non-NATO ally. WASHINGTON-President Trump on Tuesday said he intended to designate Brazil as a major non-NATO ally, a move that would deepen the U.S.'s military ties to the country, following a meeting with its new leader, Jair Bolsonaro.

title: EU Grapples With Discord on How to Treat China
summary: Xi Jinping's visit to Italy and France shows dichotomy of European views: Rome is all business, while Paris wants buffers against Chinese clout. ROME-While Europe struggles with Brexit, a visitor to its southern shore this week is exposing divisions that could have even bigger consequences for its place in the world: over how to deal with China.

title: Think Stocks Are Hot? This Car Metal Keeps Hitting New Records
summary: Palladium is up 30% so far this year and 67% from the beginning of its rally in August. A metal that is key to filtering car emissions is one of the best-performing investments this year, boosted by greater environmental scrutiny of auto makers and signs of a supply crunch.

title: Stocks Close Lower as Weak Utilities Offset Strength in Consumer Shares
summary: Investors look ahead to updates from central banks and developments in U.S.-China trade talks. The S&P 500 slipped Tuesday as declines in utilities shares offset gains in consumer-discretionary stocks.

title: Canada Unveils Billions in New Spending in Pre-Election Budget
summary: Liberal government announces tax-and-spending plan as it seeks to turn page from political crisis. OTTAWA-Canada's Liberal government on Tuesday presented a pre-election budget plan that offered over $10 billion in new, short-term spending, spread across a range of constituencies, as it tried to soften the blow from a damaging political crisis.

title: U.S. Oil Slips From Four-Month High
summary: Profit-taking follows a report that China plans to roll back supposed earlier concessions made in talks with the U.S.. • U.S. oil prices pulled back from a four-month high Tuesday over concerns about the progress of U.S.-China trade negotiations and as shale producers began hedging their output to lock in relatively high prices.

title: Google Unveils High-End Gaming Service Without a Console
summary: Stadia lets players stream videogames directly to phones, PCs, and TVs. Google unveiled a new service called Stadia that lets players stream videogames from the cloud without needing pricey hardware-an elusive feat that could change the way people buy and play games.

title: Pope Refuses Resignation of Cardinal Convicted of Covering Up Sex Abuse
summary: Pontiff advises Philippe Barbarin to make the best decision for Lyon archdiocese; alleged victims bemoan decision. ROME-Pope Francis declined to accept the resignation of a French cardinal convicted of covering up sexual abuse, the Vatican said on Tuesday, a decision that drew fire from victims and their advocates in France and abroad.

title: High-Level U.S.-China Trade Talks to Resume in Final Push for Deal
summary: Negotiators aim to close an agreement by April, individuals tracking the discussions say. WASHINGTON-Negotiators for the U.S. and China have scheduled a new round of high-level trade talks in Beijing and Washington, aiming to close a deal by late April to end the yearlong dispute between the world's two largest economies.

title: U.S. Sanctions Venezuela's State Gold-Mining Company
summary: Move furthers American effort to cut off income for President Maduro's government. WASHINGTON-The U.S. Treasury Department imposed sanctions on Venezuela's state-owned gold-mining company and the company's president, and President Trump later said the U.S. could go "a lot tougher" on the government of President Nicolás Maduro.

title: Glossier Tops Billion-Dollar Valuation With Latest Funding
summary: New York startup is now a 'unicorn' with $100 million Series D led by Sequoia Capital. What started as a beauty blog is now a billion-dollar business.

title: JLL to Pay $2 Billion for Rival HFF
summary: Deal allows Chicago-based firm to greatly expand its business of selling and financing commercial property. Jones Lang LaSalle Inc., one of the world's largest commercial real-estate services firms, said it would pay about $2 billion for rival HFF Inc. in a late-cycle deal that marks JLL's largest acquisition since the firm was formed in 1999 by the merger of LaSalle Partners Inc. and Jones Lang Wootton.

title: Bondholders Accuse LBI, HPS of Insider Trading in Debt
summary: Broadcaster and rescue financier deny allegations of illegal trading. Bondholders say Spanish-language broadcaster LBI Media Inc.'s bankruptcy-exit plan is a product of insider trading and fraud, a violation of the rules of engagement in a market where aggressive trades are the norm.

title: Elizabeth Warren Isn't Qualified to Teach History, Either
summary: The 'ideas' candidate is now exploring slavery reparations.. Trailing the Democratic presidential pack in opinion surveys and fundraising, Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D., Mass.) is urging Americans to consider a new redistribution of wealth. The basic idea is that the federal government will apportion among the citizens living now the historical guilt for heinous acts committed by people long dead against other people long dead. Then money would flow from people who have not been convicted of any crime to people who have not been found by any court to have been victimized by a crime.

title: U.S. Government Bonds Fall as Fed Meeting Begins
summary: Investors speculated central bank will continue to emphasize a patient approach to adjusting interest-rate policy. U.S. government-bond prices fell Tuesday as investors speculated that the Federal Reserve would continue to emphasize a patient approach to adjusting interest-rate policy as it starts its two-day meeting in Washington.

title: Google's Gaming Cloud Needs More Games
summary: Impressive game-streaming service still needs compelling content. So far, Google has gotten cloud-based videogaming half right. The other half will prove a major challenge.

title: Inside Europe's First Underwater Restaurant, Where the Algae Is Haute Cuisine
summary: You enter by gangplank, and the concrete walls are three feet-thick. But for Norway's Ubostad brothers, the challenge of constructing an underwater restaurant was part of the allure: "People around here think of what's possible rather than what's impossible.". Last summer, after six months of construction on a barge off the craggy Southern coast of Norway, developers and engineers filled the restaurant Under with 450 tons of water and were thrilled to watch it sink. When the structure's 1600 tons of concrete had been manipulated into place by a floating crane and bolted to the ocean floor, and after the seawater had been pumped out and the unit sealed so none could rush back in, the owners had officially reached their goal. "It's Europe's first underwater restaurant," says Stig Ubostad, who with his older brother and business partner Gaute Ubostad spent just over 8 million dollars to achieve their subaquatic dream.

title: Sea to It
summary: Inside the new restaurant Under. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: BW Group Set to Buy LPG Carrier Epic Gas
summary: Buyout extends expansion plan for world's biggest ocean carrier of propane and butane. BW Group, the world's biggest operator of liquid petroleum gas ships, is pushing ahead with acquisition-fed expansion with plans to buy all of the remaining shares of LPG-ship owner Epic Gas that it doesn't already own.

title: Gold Climbs Ahead of Fed Statement
summary: Metal gets help from a weaker dollar; copper prices also rise.. Gold prices rose Tuesday, supported by a weaker dollar as analysts looked ahead to Wednesday's statement from the Federal Reserve.

title: What If Zion Williamson Went to Wofford?
summary: The Wofford Terriers are a trendy pick in the NCAA tournament. They were also the first school to recruit college basketball's best player.. Zion Williamson is hard to miss. The best player in college basketball gobbles attention everywhere he goes and blends into crowds about as well as an elephant. One night a few years ago, when he was only 16 years old, he went to his local college on a Saturday night for a game. He did not exactly go unnoticed.

title: 'Berthe Morisot, Woman Impressionist' Review: A Legacy Restored
summary: Morisot-who, in her time, was a critically acclaimed Impressionist admired by Manet, Monet, Renoir and Degas-is finally being recognized again.. Dallas

title: DSW to Rebrand in Shift to More In-House Lines
summary: Shoe retailer posts surprise in latest quarter, projects profit for current fiscal year below analysts' expectations. DSW Inc. said Tuesday it is changing its name and will add more of its own products on store shelves in a pivot from solely selling other designers' shoes and accessories.

title: 'Past Time: Geology in European and American Art' Review: From Gorge to Gallery and Back
summary: An exhibition at the Herbert F. Johnson Museum of Art offers a novel perspective on landscape painting..

title: 'Nantucket Sleigh Ride' Review: Youthful Zest, Leavened With Experience
summary: John Guare's latest is a blackish farce about an aging playwright-turned-businessman who finds himself flung back into the past..

title: New York's Road-Repair Funding Gap Sparks Driver Tax Debate
summary: Watchdog group says 1-cent-per-mile fee could raise $1.2 billion to fix state highways, fund mass transit. New York should wean itself off its reliance on gas taxes and consider charging motorists by the mile to pay for roads and bridges, a watchdog group said in a report released Tuesday.

title: Judge Tosses Hedge Fund's Lawsuit Against Neiman Marcus
summary: Bondholder Marble Ridge Capital loses legal fight over controversial transfer of retailer's MyTheresa business. A Texas judge Tuesday dismissed a bondholder lawsuit against Neiman Marcus Group over the company's transfer of its MyTheresa e-commerce business beyond the reach of bondholders.

title: Statue of Liberty Climber Sentenced to Five Years Probation
summary: Immigrant-rights activist's move set off security concerns and evacuation of the landmark. NEW YORK-An immigrant-rights activist who climbed the Statue of Liberty's base last Fourth of July, sparking security concerns and the landmark's evacuation, was sentenced Tuesday to five years of probation and 200 hours of community service.

title: Facebook Axes Age, Gender and Other Targeting for Some Sensitive Ads
summary: Zip-code targeting for housing, job and credit ads will be ended, while Lookalike Audience tool will be restricted. Facebook Inc. is removing age, gender and ZIP Code targeting for housing, employment and credit-related ads as part of a settlement with advocacy groups and other plaintiffs.

title: Mike Trout, Angels Near Record $430 Million Deal
summary: Trout's new extension becomes the largest guarantee in baseball history. Bryce Harper's stint as the recipient of the largest guarantee in baseball history lasted less than three weeks. Mike Trout didn't just beat Harper's contract-he obliterated it in every conceivable way, setting a new standard that comes with massive implications for all of professional sports.

title: Norsk Hydro Hit by Ransomware Cyberattack
summary: The company, one of the world's largest aluminum producers, says its operations were crippled. Norsk Hydro AS said it suffered a ransomware cyberattack Tuesday that crippled computers and production at the aluminum and energy giant.

title: Xiaomi Swings to Profit in 2018
summary: Chinese company's smartphone shipments rose 30%, bucking global trend last year. Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi Corp. swung to a profit in 2018, as its push to boost sales of its more expensive handsets continued to pay off.

title: Florida Prosecutors Offer to Drop Charges Against Patriots Owner Kraft
summary: The proposed deal, however, calls for Kraft to admit he would have been found guilty at trial. Florida prosecutors have offered to drop charges against New England Patriots owner Robert Kraft and a number of other men charged with soliciting prostitution, according to a person familiar with the matter, but there is a catch. The proposed agreement calls for the men to admit they would have been proven guilty at trial.

title: Former AOL Boss Getting More Than $60 Million as He Exits Verizon
summary: The former Yahoo and AOL businesses failed to meet revenue targets, and Verizon took a $4.5 billion charge in the fourth quarter. Tim Armstrong, the former leader of AOL, is walking away with more than $60 million as he leaves Verizon Communications Inc., which recently wrote down half the value of the internet business he led.

title: Trump Calls Husband of Adviser Conway a 'Total Loser'
summary: George Conway has been longtime critic of President Trump. WASHINGTON-President Trump on Tuesday lashed out at the husband of one of his senior advisers, calling George Conway-a frequent critic of the president-a "total loser."

title: Maduro Loses Grip on Venezuela's Poor, a Vital Source of His Power
summary: Resume Subscription. LA VEGA, Venezuela-This nation's slums have been the backbone of the leftist government for decades, and one of few remaining bulwarks for President Nicolás Maduro. They are now turning on the embattled leader-a shift born of economic misery and police violence that could cost him the country.

title: New York City's Food Hall Trend Migrates to the Suburbs
summary: Food halls are opening in locales well outside Manhattan and Brooklyn.

title: Would You Ever Wear Overalls in the City?
summary: Although other workwear staples have become commonplace, the practical pull-on has largely labored on the farm. Menswear editor Jacob Gallagher tests their viability on the town. I RECENTLY STEPPED into a pair of denim Carhartt overalls and with the click of the buckles-voilà!-I was transformed from a mellow Brooklynite into an old-fashioned coalman. The sort who kept 1930s trains running. Or, I thought, studying the mirror, I could pass for a '50s farmer, rustling up corn. (Is corn something one "rustles up"?) I certainly didn't feel like myself.

title: The Underdogs to Pull Off NCAA Tournament Upsets
summary: There are five upsets that shouldn't be surprising, according to our resident upsetologist.. There are many ways you can predict NCAA tournament upsets. You can flip a coin. You can fling yourself into a rabbithole of mascot research. You can ask your dog. Or your cat. Or the nearest octopus.

title: More Detail and Plain English: Auditors' Reports Get a Makeover
summary: Investors can expect a report offering a glimpse at what the auditor considers the knottiest issues in a company's financial statements. Coming soon: More insights for investors about the biggest concerns lurking in their companies' financial results.

title: London Museum Will Forgo Donation From Sackler Family
summary: Suits alleging role in opioid crisis have spurred institutions to rethink philanthropic relationship. Britain's National Portrait Gallery won't proceed with a £1 million ($1.3 million) pledge from a charitable organization overseen by some members of the Sackler family, the latest crack in a philanthropic image cultivated by the owners of OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma LP that is facing increasing scrutiny over the company's role in the U.S.'s opioid crisis.

title: Which 'Jen' Sent the Baby Gift Cards? Not One You Know.
summary: Marketing stunt targets pregnant women with gift cards and coupons from 'Jen'. Rebecca Kinney, a pregnant 24-year-old from Spokane, Wash., received a greeting card in the mail several weeks ago with about $200 in gift cards for baby products.

title: Fed Faces Crucial Decision on Mix of Treasurys in Its Portfolio
summary: Favoring short-term notes is seen as giving central bank more flexibility if economic growth slows. Markets have cheered the Federal Reserve's imminent announcement that it will stop shrinking its asset portfolio later this year, but determining that date is just one challenge facing central-bank officials.

title: Islamic State Uses Propaganda to Rally Supporters as Caliphate Withers
summary: In a change of tactic, extremist group calls for retaliation over mosque attacks in New Zealand. BEIRUT-As Islamic State battles to keep control of its last slice of territory in Syria, the extremist group's propaganda machine is invoking international acts of terrorism in a bid to rally its remaining supporters.

title: Why I'm Swapping my iPhone for an Alarm Clock From 1939
summary: Columnist Michelle Slatalla makes a case for turning back the hands of time and embracing an object designed to perform a single task flawlessly. SOME PEOPLE LOOK at an iPhone and see a stylish, sleek slice of the future. I see a greasy, fingerprinted screen lying on my night stand.

title: Ichiro Suzuki Gets a Final Bow in Tokyo
summary: The 45-year-old Japanese star will be in the lineup when the Mariners open the season against the Athletics. Anybody dedicated enough-or crazy enough-to wake up before the sunrise to watch baseball's season-opener in Japan on Wednesday will witness something rarely seen in the sport's history: an honest-to-goodness middle-aged man on the field.

title: New Hotels Mushroom in Miami
summary: Developers add thousands of new rooms as sales set records. Hotel construction is booming in Miami thanks partly to the growing appeal of the city's downtown district and the flocking of well-heeled tourists to South Beach.

title: California Has the Jobs but Not Enough Homes
summary: Companies are expanding outside the state or moving outright as an affordable-housing crisis casts a shadow on the booming economy. SAN FRANCISCO-California's economy is adding jobs far faster than affordable places to live, forcing some employers to leave the state as they expand.

title: Facebook Live Has Got to Go
summary: The social-media giant may be doing more harm than good with live video. Facebook 's live-video feature is becoming a viral problem with no apparent antidote.

title: Auto Parts Supplier BorgWarner Names New Finance Chief
summary: The company's management forecasts lower sales, and plans to cut costs. Automotive parts supplier BorgWarner Inc. on Tuesday named Kevin Nowlan as its new finance chief, tasking him with cutting costs to cope with the car industry's headwinds in markets such as China and Europe.

title: L.A. Times Owner Sets Ambitious Goal: Five Million Digital Subscribers
summary: The paper now has 150,000 digital-only subscribers, almost double what it had when biotech billionaire Patrick Soon-Shiong took over. After years of declining readership and endless newsroom cuts, the new owner of the Los Angeles Times is setting a high target in his effort to turn the company around.

title: The $1 Million HOA Blowup: It Started With the Misplaced Flower Pots
summary: Resume Subscription. OLATHE, Kan.-Soon after Jim Hildenbrand arrived in Avignon Villa Homes, a community for older adults in a Kansas City suburb, the homeowner association disputed the placement of his satellite dish. It cited him for parking cars in his driveway overnight and placing a St. Francis statue in a flower bed. He was later written up for a dead cat in a window well-which Mr. Hildenbrand suspects was planted by a neighborhood enemy.

title: No-Frills Gym Chain Bulks Up Thanks to Workout Boom
summary: Planet Fitness's valuation soars as it attracts newcomers with cheap memberships, casual environment and free pizza. Planet Fitness Inc. is expanding by going lean, pulling in customers with a $10-a-month membership fee and a no-frills atmosphere.

title: Xiaomi Needs to Profit More From Abroad
summary: Chinese smartphone maker is growing fast in places like India. But that isn't adding much to bottom line yet.. Smartphone maker Xiaomi is one of China's homegrown champions. Yet its future will depend more on growth from outside the country.

title: Would You Buy a Luxury Watch Online?
summary: As websites like Mr Porter and the Real Real build out their luxury watch sections, buying high-value timepieces on the internet has become more commonplace. IF YOU'RE IN the market for an $18,600, 18-karat-gold Vacheron Constantin wrist watch but can't imagine peeling yourself off the couch, you're in luck. Log onto MrPorter.com and you can buy one as seamlessly as a $35 J. Crew T-shirt. And if you live in New York or London and want it on your wrist by the time you're scarfing down dinner, you could even have it messengered over.

title: From Billie Eilish, a Hotly Anticipated Debut Album
summary: The fast-rising 17-year-old singer readies 'When We All Fall Asleep, Where Do We Go?'. Billie Eilish was struggling to come up with a title for her debut album.

title: Here's the Pitch: An Investor Club Open to All Entrepreneurs
summary: Weekly gathering of deal makers at Manhattan's 40/40 Club welcomes anyone with a good business idea. When Raina Casbon-Kelts recently pitched a roomful of potential investors on Gilded, her cryptocurrency-accounting software, she was stumped by a seemingly simple question: How would she pay investors back?

title: The Art of Being Single
summary: Single people still face a stigma, even though their ranks have grown. Yet a new study suggests singles become happier as they age. One strategy: Focus on creating a full life now, for yourself, rather than finding a partner.. After Katie Tomaszewski divorced at the age of 28, she felt ashamed to be alone. So she did what she thought a single person should do: She over-dated, over-worked and over-socialized, inviting friends over for dinner nearly every night because she was afraid of being lonely.

title: A Suburban Tale of Two Ronnies
summary: Singer Ronnie Spector says having a happy family life at home gives her the energy to keep her stage career going. Ronnie Spector, 75, is lead singer of the Ronettes and a Rock & Roll Hall of Fame inductee whose hits include "Be My Baby" and "Walking in the Rain." Ms. Spector is touring the U.S. this spring. She spoke with Marc Myers.

title: Alleged Tipster in College-Cheating Scandal Bribed a Coach, Source Says
summary: Morrie Tobin, the dad who is said to have led federal agents to Yale's soccer coach, was also a participant in the scam, according to a person familiar with the investigation. Morrie Tobin, the Yale dad who allegedly tipped off federal authorities to what they say is the largest college-admissions cheating scam they've ever prosecuted, wasn't just an informant. He was also among the parents who participated in the scheme, according to a person familiar with the investigation.

title: Virtual Casinos Deliver a Tricky Jackpot to the Philippines
summary: Resume Subscription. MANILA, Philippines-In casino halls packed into this city's premium high-rise office towers, young, skimpily dressed croupiers deal cards and flash winning smiles for Chinese gamblers. Only there is no one else there. The players are connected by webcam.

title: A Vintage Cadillac and One Family's Remarkable Saga
summary: Resume Subscription. Michael Patris, 59, president of Golden West Books-a publisher of books on trains and railroads-on his 1920 Cadillac Model 59, as told to A.J. Baime.

title: Photos: A Classic Cadillac With a Back Story Beyond Belief
summary: The family that owned this 1920 Model 59 has been making history since the Civil War. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Stocks to Watch: Disney, Blackstone, Amazon.com, Okta, Starbucks
summary: Resume Subscription. Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Tuesday's session. Stock movements noted by ticker reflect movements during regular trading hours; premarket trading is specified separately.

title: Instagram Takes on Amazon With New Shopping Feature
summary: Photo platform's role in the transaction could make some consumers wary, given Facebook's stumbles. Instagram is going deeper into the e-commerce business, for the first time selling to its users products they see on the photo-heavy social network's feeds.

title: Passive Investing Gains Even in Turbulent Times
summary: Exchange-traded funds were a source of stability for investors during the latest market selloff. Passive funds are cheaper and higher-yielding than their peers. Damningly for active investment managers, they may also turn out to be a better haven in turbulent times.

title: Argentinian Company Wants to Build the Amazon of Latin America
summary: Buenos Aires-based e-commerce company is working to strengthen its foothold in the region and fend off Amazon and Alibaba. MercadoLibre Inc. is attempting to become the Amazon.com Inc. of Latin America, but first it will need to keep the e-commerce giant at bay. And that will come at a cost.

title: U.S., Allies Capture Islamic State Fighters Tied to Killing of Four Americans
summary: Americans were killed in January by suicide bomber at a restaurant in Manbij. WASHINGTON-U.S. officials and their allies in Syria have detained several Islamic State fighters who they believe were responsible for the deadliest attack against American forces since U.S. ground troops first arrived there in 2015.

title: Kushner Cos. Scales Back in New York as Public Scrutiny Heats Up
summary: Faced with fierce anti-Trump sentiment in city, real-estate firm formerly led by Jared Kushner looks to suburbs. Kushner Cos. left its suburban roots behind years ago to pursue big property investments in New York City. Now, under fire from New York politicians and tenant activists, it is increasingly turning back to the 'burbs.

title: Federal Investigators Probe Boeing 737 MAX Development Choices
summary: Probes to focus on stall-prevention system and examine whether any shortcuts compromised safety. Federal investigators and lawmakers are asking the same question about Boeing Co. 's 737 MAX jet: Did U.S. safety regulators rigorously follow longstanding engineering and design standards in approving a suspect stall-prevention feature?

title: Japan's Olympic Chief, Focus of Bribery Probe, to Step Down
summary: Tsunekazu Takeda, who has been JOC president since 2001, reiterated that he had done nothing wrong. TOKYO-The president of the Japanese Olympic Committee said he would step down, two months after French authorities said they were investigating whether he sanctioned bribes to help Tokyo win the 2020 Olympic Games.

title: Investing in Europe's Japanification
summary: The slowdown in European growth and inflation has Wall Street worrying about the Tokyo precedent.

title: Companies Call for Oversight of Firms That Advise Shareholders
summary: Securities regulators are weighing options that could limit the influence of proxy-advisory firms. WASHINGTON-Companies want the firms that advise shareholders on proxy proposals to face government oversight of their activities, a wish securities regulators are expected to act on as early as this spring.

title: Accused New Zealand Gunman Takes a Page From Mass Killers in Forgoing Lawyer
summary: Plan challenges justice system's ability to balance right to a fair trial with desire to deny a new platform to spout hate. The accused New Zealand shooter's plan to represent himself in court borrows from the playbook of previous mass murderers, challenging the justice system's ability to balance his right to a fair trial with the desire to deny him a new platform to spout hate.

title: For Many Girls, Figure Skating Loses Its Edge to Hockey
summary: A surge in girls' ice hockey comes as many embrace competitive team sport, spurning the makeup and sequins associated with figure skating. On a recent Saturday morning, 8-year-old Sara Caldicott tied her skates, left foot first, then right, sitting on a bench at the Rockville Ice Arena in Maryland. But instead of spandex and sequins, she wore shin guards and a helmet.

title: Special Counsel's Cohen Probe Dates to 2017, New Documents Show
summary: Investigation of Trump's former personal lawyer shifted to campaign-finance violations in early 2018. Newly unsealed documents show that agents working for special counsel Robert Mueller began investigating Michael Cohen in the middle of 2017, only two months after Mr. Mueller took on his role and earlier than previously known.

title: White House Seeks Ways to Get More People to Work
summary: New report promotes policies to increase labor-force participation as millions of baby boomers retire. The White House in a new report highlighted the strength of the labor-force participation rate and pushed for policies to encourage more people to work as millions of baby boomers retire.

title: Cyclone Shows Climate Change's Deadly Impact on Poor Nations
summary: Southern Africa struggles as global funds to shore up infrastructure and protect populations lag far behind promises. The tropical cyclone that tore through Mozambique and other Southern African nations has spotlighted how the combination of rapid urbanization and climate change is turning deadly in some of the world's poorest places.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: West Virginia Suit Says Diocese Knowingly Employed Pedophiles
summary: Lawsuit says bishops knew of sexual-abuse complaints against priests but didn't disclose conduct to authorities or parents. West Virginia's attorney general sued the state's Catholic diocese and its former bishop, saying they knowingly employed pedophiles, including an admitted abuser who was allowed to work in an elementary school.

title: Budweiser Maker Pushes K-Cup Machine for Cocktails
summary: Anheuser-Busch InBev and Keurig Dr Pepper to sell single-serve beverage devices through Drinkworks joint venture. Keurig Dr Pepper Inc. and Anheuser-Busch InBev SA are pushing ahead with an idea to automate home bartending with a K-Cup machine for cocktails, seeking to tap new areas of growth as sales of their core products slow.

title: How the National Enquirer Got Bezos' Texts: It Paid $200,000 to His Lover's Brother
summary: Michael Sanchez sold the billionaire's secrets to American Media, the Enquirer's publisher, said people familiar with the matter. Amazon.com Inc. founder Jeff Bezos and his allies have publicly speculated about how the National Enquirer acquired racy texts he sent to his girlfriend, including at one point hinting Saudi Arabia or the White House may have been involved.

title: Man Accused in Killing Reputed Mob Boss Waives Extradition
summary: Anthony Comello, who was arrested in New Jersey, will face charges in the Staten Island shooting death of reputed Gambino family crime boss Francesco Cali. The man accused of killing reputed Gambino family crime boss Francesco Cali on Staten Island last week appeared in criminal court in Ocean County, N.J., on Monday and waived extradition back to New York City, where he will face charges, his lawyer said.

title: Kazakhstan's President to Step Down After Almost Three Decades
summary: Central Asian nation faces its greatest period of uncertainty since fall of Soviet Union. MOSCOW-Kazakhstan's president, an autocrat who has ruled since the fall of the Soviet Union, unexpectedly announced his resignation on Tuesday, plunging Central Asia's biggest energy exporter into its greatest period of uncertainty in three decades.
